The World is changing.

Are your Compliance & Anti_Money Laundering programs up to the challenge?

Private Sector innovation, including new ways of using existing tools or adoption new technologies, can help banks identify and report money laundering, terrorist financing, and other illicit financial activity by enhancing the effectiveness and efficiency of banks’ BSA / AML compliance programs,

US Banking Regulators’ Joint Statement on Innovative Efforts to Combat Money Laundering and Terrorist Financing, December 3, 2019

Amount Spent on Compliance & AML Per Year

59%

Amount of regulatory fines since financial crises

$29m Disclosures

Average number of regulatory changes per day

200
Disclosures

Compliance and AML spend data courtesy of International Banker, The Cost of Compliance (November, 2018). Amount of regulatory fines and number of regulatory changes courtesy of the Boston Consulting Group, Global Risk 2018: Future-Proofing the Bank Risk Agenda (February, 2018).
